title: 80's typography
content:
i'm working on magazine layout for an article about the eighties, and i'm looking for typical 80's typography. do you have any suggestions/examples i can get inspired by?

thanks!

:)
author: jreker

comments.content:
Check out our 1980s New Wave type category!

[http://www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?search=action&keywords=neww...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021911/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?search=action&keywords=newwave&template=Templates/Category.html&sortkey=order&sortorder=descending&sortby=recent "http://www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?search=action&keywords=newwave&template=Templates/Category.html&sortkey=order&sortorder=descending&sortby=recent")

Stuart :D

Helvetica, and use all caps, do some bold colors or colors that contrast so much they "move" and geometry stuff

Run DMC's logo used Helvetica

Something like that, but I wouldnt use the condensed version. Do it [RUN DMC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021911/http:/images.google.com/images?hl=en&safe=active&client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&hs=kf9&q=run%20dmc%20logo&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wi) style

You could use some [trapper keeper](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021911/http:/images.google.com/images?q=trapper+keeper&oe=utf-8&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&client=firefox-a&um=1&ie=UTF-8&ei=CGa1Sq-GCN6g8QbHrMyTDw&sa=X&oi=image_result_group&ct=title&resnum=4) designs for inspiration
